data.title: Rename Css -> CSS
data.body:
Related d172645.
This PR just rename Css to CSS.

data.title: Error 407
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Ext Install - displays list of extension
2. On clicking the extension I get a 407 error.
3. I have tried by setting proxy and without, the behavior is the same.

data.title: Feature request: add dropdownlist when too much statusbar buttons
data.body:
Hello,

For now, when you add a lot of items to the statusbar via plugins, only first few items are displayed and the remaining items are hidden.

It would be great to have a dropdownlist which will show all those remaining items.

I hope such a feature could enhance vscode.

Thanks in advance for your comments.

data.title: Test `editor.wordBasedSuggestions` setting
data.body:
- [x] any os - **@dbaeumer**
#5574

Test that there is a new user setting called `editor.wordBasedSuggestions` that allows to enable/disable textual completions.

data.title: The .deb-installation should create a nice icon in the Ubuntu Launcher
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download .deb-installer for version 1.1.1
2. Install using dpkg -i vscode-amd64.deb
3. Wait a minute and open the launcher menu and search for "Code", and you will see this generic icon without a title:

![screenshot from 2016-05-23 09-07-36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1387518/15462868/d1402bc2-20c5-11e6-8b61-1ceb343ed41b.png)

This icon is currently located at /usr/share/applications/code.desktop and it references a non-existent code.png as far as I can see.

This icon could be made much better by default. By renaming `/usr/share/applications/code.desktop` to `/usr/share/applications/vscode.desktop` the icon title appears in the launcher (I'm not sure why). The icon appears by changing the icon entry to `Icon=/usr/share/code/resources/app/resources/linux/code.png` for both occurences in the file.

I haven't opened this as a pull request, as I am not sure how it affects the .deb installation process.

data.title: test new `vscode.diff` command
data.body:
- [x] any os - **@bpasero**
#1865

There is a new command to compare two resources: `vscode.diff`. Make sure that
- the commands checks its constraints (try with invalid arguments)
- the command is documented (will be generated from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHostApiCommands.ts#L201)

data.title: Test goto definition enhancements
data.body:
- [x] any os - **@sandy081**
#5893

We have improved the go to definition behaviour when a symbol as multiple definitions. When having multiple definitions, make sure that
- we reveal the _first_ definition and show the peek window with further definitions
- the first definition is the _nearest_ wrt to position and file path
- selecting an item in the peek window tree (enter/double-click) reveals that definition and closes the peek window
- other peek feature (cmd+click, etc) still work

data.title: Test file-link detection
data.body:
- [x] any - **@kieferrm**
#6533

Make sure that file-links are detected as links, underlined, and open the file on selection. Test with windows and nix file paths.

data.title: Coloring format is messed up with different VScode theme for PS cmdlets, parameter name and value.
data.body:
I compare VSCode coloring with Visual studio with different themes and observed that the cmdlet, parameter name and values are not following correct pattern.
Actual: 
1. With Light (Visual Studio) and Dark+ (Default Dark) themes the PS comdlet , parameter and parameter value are displaying in the same color.

![vslighttheme](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15461182/8ec3af4c-206d-11e6-908a-989b2bf363f8.png)
1. When multiple parameters are provide with the command then they are displaying in the different color.
   Exp: In the below screenshot you can see -class and -computer is displaying in different color and Win32_OperatingSystem and localhost are displaying in different color.
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15461045/0fdc8eb6-206c-11e6-89aa-bd88d2d189bf.png)
   Expected: Cmdlet, parameter and value should be display in three different colors and should be consistent in the script file same like visual studio.
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15461179/87087c92-206d-11e6-8241-2b960c924324.png)

data.title: Make resource content provider a service or registry

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently there is an ugly static method in `ResourceEditorInput` to register a URI-to-Model provider. This should move into a service or platform registry for resolving models and registering schemes.

We should also adopt it to replace the following inputs:
- DefaultSettingsInput
- DefaultKeybindingsInput
- NativeGitIndexStringEditorInput?

data.title: exported variable do not return correct type
data.body:
**TypeScript Version:** 

1.8.10 Win10, VSCode 1.1.1

TS config:

``` ts
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "module": "commonjs",
        "target": "es5",
        "noImplicitAny": false,
        "outDir": "dist",
        "rootDir": "src",
        "sourceMap": true
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules"
    ]
}
```

**Code**

``` ts

export interface IDeviceIdentsAttributes {
    id_device: number
    id_ident_type: number
    ident_value: string
}

export interface IDeviceIdentsInstance extends sequelize.Instance<IDeviceIdentsAttributes> { }
export var DeviceIdents = db.connection.define<IDeviceIdentsInstance, IDeviceIdentsAttributes>('device_idents', {model definition}, {options) 
```

**Expected behavior:**

exported DeviceIdents should return type: **sequelize.Model<IDeviceIdentsInstance, IDeviceIdentsAttributes>**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5012042/15458511/8bc0a4ca-209b-11e6-95b0-96f00d7ad72f.png)

**Actual behavior:** 

exported DeviceIdents returns **any**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5012042/15458506/72171158-209b-11e6-944f-9464baec7b42.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5012042/15458498/5f8f23e0-209b-11e6-85a4-e7d43c106636.png)

data.title: pass to next selection behaviour after ctrl+d
data.body:
When i hit `ctrl+d` it selects next matching occurrence this is great but what if the next occurrence  is not something i wanna match.
For example if i want to edit all the whole words "ate" `ctrl+d` will match `donate` too.
In brackets editor theres a great solution to this `ctrl+d` matches next and if its not right match `ctrl+shift+d` skips the match to the next .

data.title: Unexpected intellisense behavior & warning in Sass

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Recent alpha 23c927e
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open .scss file
2. Inside a rule add `"margin: "`
3. Trigger intellisense <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>space</kbd>
4. Type `"0 0 0 0;"`
5. Press <kbd>enter</kbd>

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/15456943/3a77aee0-2034-11e6-8a95-300426e0ea63.png)

At this point I expect the cursor to go to a new line but it tried to accept "No suggestions" and failed. I also think intellisense should be dismissed after the semi-colon `;` is entered.

data.title: Excluding devDependencies when building a binary
data.body: I was looking at building a binary of vscode and the gulp task `vscode-win32` is copying in all of the devDependencies, how do you all exclude the devDependencies from the built binary?

data.title: Expand TypeScript Interface in IntelliSense
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.10.5

When using the typescript definitions installed from definitely typed, the IntelliSense doesn't seem to want to expand things that are declared as "interfaces". I've attached a snippet below as an example.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1591483/15456376/ac916b58-203c-11e6-9f6d-25e5bcff7ef1.png)

From this screen shot, I have no way of knowing what is expected from the IRouteConfiguration interface.

Am I missing a setting somewhere or is this working as intended and I have to click around before being able to learn what the shape of that interface is?

**Update** 
It appears that once you start filling out the object, it does give you hints about the value you are using, but it seems like you already need to have an idea of the shape of the object before you start typing.

data.title: --reuse-window and OS X fullscreen window switching

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5 (15F34)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode and Terminal
2. Make them both fullscreen (either split screen or same screen)
3. In the fullscreen Terminal, run `code --reuse-window`
4. Observe that OS X snaps you back to the original Desktop that you opened the two apps in, then back to VSCode.

data.title: "No console output" mode?
data.body:
I could not figure out the following: I'd like to setup VSCode to be run from console (i.e. powershell)
When I do so, VSCode doesn't block the execution, but it start output log into the console, so it became unusable. How can I tell it not to do the logs? Also, I would suggest make it the default behavior and add the opposite flag: `--verbose`
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.1.1
Commit def9e32467ad6e4f48787d38caf190acbfee5880
Date 2016-05-13T13:29:20.776Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
- OS Version: Windows 10
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open powershell.exe
2. Run `Set-Alias code "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe"` so you can use it as a command.
3. Open current directory with `code .`
4. Control is returned to you
### expected

no output on the console from vscode
### actual

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/816680/15455627/6dbada1e-200e-11e6-9a38-86d4b4a8aeaa.png)

data.title: [ts] Syntax Highlighting Issue: Template Strings and Semicolons
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.1.1 - OS Version: OSX 10.11.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Insert the following TypeScript code into the editor: ``` ts var a = true ? true : `;`; var i; ``` 1. Observe that `var i;` is colored as if it were part of the template string (in VSCode, and on GitHub!). Removing any part of the first line prevents the bug. It only appears to occur when combining variable assignment, the ternary operator, and a template string containing a semicolon (`;`). Further Info: A single occurrence of this bug can derail syntax highlighting for the rest of the file, since template strings are multi-line. Template strings with semicolons can be a common occurrence for projects that generate JavaScript as output, and ternaries are a common case when wanting to handle a slight variation in output.

data.title: On Linux/*nix platforms VSCode not escaping spaces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS Linux kernel 4.4.0-22

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try opening a folder which contains spaces

Code does not understand folders with spaces in unix environments, escaping the names in a terminal result the arguments being passed with spaces ("% code ~/my\ folder" results in argument "my folder" to the code application, which being opened inside the application results in two different folders/files).

Passing "my\ scripts\ folder/script.cs" results in four files opened, "~/my", "~/scripts", "~/folder" and "~/script.cs"

data.title: Compilation Hints Get Scrambled
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11.4

This has been an annoying issue ever since I started using VS Code in March. I've been living with it and don't want to complain because I love VS Code, but perhaps it will help if I report it.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Work normally and do a minor refactor, change the signature of a method, or modify a class structure
2. The compilation hints spontaneously get all scrambled and remain that way

Sometimes clicking on the error list and selecting an "error" from the list jumps me to the source location helps to snap VS Code out of it, but most often I need to save everything and restart VS Code to fix it. Then it "re-indexes" the code and the mistaken compilation error hints go away. Executing `dotnet build` doesn't do it.

Attached is a screenshot showing a very weird one that occurred spontaneously just now.

`Type 'ServiceLogRepository' already defines a member called '.ctor' with the same parameter types [netcoreapp1.0]`

I hope I'm getting the terminology decently OK here, there are probably better names for things.

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16694050/15455190/f9002a1e-2001-11e6-8727-91bbad040c28.jpg)

data.title: Console log disappeared
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1 
- OS Version: Enu Win7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open a Typescript projects based on nodejs.
2.  
   strike F1 and type rub to get run build tasks  and strike enter to build the project.
3. No console logs show now.
4. Strike F5 to run the project, no console log any more.
5. Relaunch the VS Code will resolve the issue but happen again when repeater step 2.

data.title: Menus do not align with High Contrast

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows Server 2012 R2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Switch the color theme to High Contrast.
2. Click any menu item from the menu bar, the dropdown menu is displayed. But the background color is white, and the foreground (text) color is white too.
3. When mouse over the dropdown menu item, you can see the foreground color changes to black and you can see the menu itme.

data.title: Textual proposals get same score as JSON proposals
data.body:
- settings file, copy over some settings, do auto complete:
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/15453732/d6f025ea-2020-11e6-97aa-e36a555229f4.png)
  -> when scrolling down multiple pages, one can see some real settings.

Problem is that text proposals are contribted for language selector 'json' and get the same score as the proposals from the mode.

Likely caused by @alexandrudima change in 41302caa15c73f6ec9e8805a9f0d62db2bc5dc25
